WRITING.TEXT: 10 Cloverfield Lane is a good one. But make sure you've seen the first movie (di mo alam meron no? haha) so you won't feel "weirded" out with the ending. Nevertheless, 10 Cloverfield Lane can still stand on its own as a good psychological thriller.

Sad truth. I even hate the Masscomm Problems meme page on fb. Puro about film and radio prod content nila. Are they even aware that the course involves writing, research, media laws and ethics as well??
Finals namen sa major subject ko is gumawa ng broadsheet. Ako assigned editor-in-chief and wala akong tiwala sa mga groupmates ko kasi muka silang napilitan mag shift sa mass comm.
Sounds like 24 to me.
Oggie and the Cockroaches. It's baffling how popular it is in my country. The show is fucking annoying and a complete try hard to Tom Jerry.
"Damn it!" - Jack Bauer
Just started watching Strike Back. It definitely fills the 24 void. Heck, the show is much more well done than 24!
Please tell me the song wasn't really in the show? But if it is, I'm sold!!
upvote for that Pink Guy reference
FlashForward. Interesting concept but it just went downhill immediately after that great pilot episode.
The British writer guy in Westworld. He just takes me away from the show's intellect with his whiny screaming and swearing.
and of course, what do the other worlds look like?
Outcast.
During the show's 100th episode, it was revealed that Kenneth was born on May 27, 1781. You do the math.
Westworld Atlanta 11.22.63

The Americans
also this one
It's the holiday break right now so I just watch shows most of the day. But when I do have school (College student btw), I first do my schoolworks on Saturdays and just watch everything on Sundays.
Is it true though that it took around 500 years before someone noticed it was a brain? Can anyone send me a link to a news article regarding that. It would be a fun read.
Even though I always tell myself that I'm dropping the show after every season, I'm still interested to see the next season of American Horror Story only for its theme and cast.

WRITING.TITLE: Why does it always have to be 13 episodes?
WRITING.TEXT: I noticed on most shows that there are 13 episodes in a single season. So I'm wondering why 13? Why not 12? 15? That odd number of episodes is just bugging me sometimes haha.

Person of Interest. From the guy who also co-created Westworld. Go watch it and you'll trust Westworld more on handling the AI stuffs. Also a good action network TV show with some occasional quips and humor.

Sense8's a good show but I always just find their title sequence to be lazy. It's literally just a montage of culture's around the world. If I wanted that I would have just watched a travel docu on Nat Geo.
The Golden Age of Piracy. I'm calling it now, PirateWorld!!
When Netflix was still early in the game with their originals, I tried Hemlock Grove. Quit after four episodes when I couldn't handle the terrible acting and writing anymore.
Me too. Season 5 was my personal favorite mainly because I'm a sucker for the time travel genre and thought the show did good exploring that.

Roanoke made quite a rebound this year. It lived up to its "American Horror Story" title. Give it a shot but you'll have to endure the first half of the season as you might not enjoy the narrative format but it still has some good generic scares by AHS standards.
No. Maeve always interferes with the narrative.
Also realistically speaking, Anthony Hopkins must be fucking expensive to keep for another season so he had to go. But I'm glad his character arc wrapped up nicely.
I wonder what would happen if you say "Analysis" to the horses.
Person Of Interest Carter, Root, and Shaw are pretty strong female leads and very badass.
Kuvira was an amazing villain! Props to Zelda Williams for giving such an amazing performance.
Luke Cage was a disappointment.
